Package gameElements.screens

Class ScreenLocalGame

java.lang.Object
gameElements.screens.Screen
gameElements.screens.ScreenLocalGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class ScreenLocalGame extends Screen implements ActionListener
The screen that holds the game and its elements for the user to interact during a match (placing pieces, seeing enemy pieces, etc)
Version:
02
Author:
Nishil Anand, Pranav Gunhal

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Draws the elements of the game onto the processing window.
      Overrides:
      draw in class Screen

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed()
      Called when a mouse is pressed. If a card is right clicked and it's that player's turn, selects that piece. Starts the timer if it's not started yet. If a piece is selected and there is a left click on the board, places that piece in the board.
      Overrides:
      mousePressed in class Screen

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed()
      If enter/return is pressed the current player's turn is skipped.
      Overrides:
      keyPressed in class Screen

    • setNames

      public void setNames(String nameOne, String nameTwo)
      Sets the player's names.
      Parameters:
      nameOne - name of player one
      nameTwo - name of player two

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      Every second: - updates this.time - calls this.board.play() - checks for the game being over Also adds energy every 4 seconds.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
